medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive nonproductive cough and shortness of breath.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 6 months prior to presentation, initially diagnosed as pneumonia. He was treated with azithromycin but continued to experience progressive symptoms, including increased supplemental oxygen requirements. He had seen modest improvement after hospitalization 2 months earlier but reported ongoing progression, having lost 11 kg unintentionally over 3 months.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hypertension and gastroesophageal reflux disease.
medical_history.family_history: Family history notable for rheumatoid arthritis in one cousin.
medical_history.social_history: Worked as a drywall installer, lived in New Hampshire, had smoked one pack of cigarettes per day for 25 years but had quit 2 months before presentation. Reported no recent travel or contact with sick persons.
